tasks.description: Use `sequentialthinking` to create a detailed plan for investigating the file explorer. This plan will serve as a guide for the subsequent tasks.
validation_criteria: The plan is comprehensive and covers all aspects of the user's request.

tasks.description: Analyze the existing codebase to understand the current implementation of the file explorer, workspace management, and chat integration.
validation_criteria: Key files and code sections related to the file explorer are identified and understood.

tasks.description: Install dependencies and run the application in development mode. Figure out how to launch it with a remote debugging port for Puppeteer to connect to.
validation_criteria: The application is running and accessible for UI testing. The remote debugging port is noted.

tasks.description: Use Puppeteer to interact with the running application. Check the file explorer's current state, its integration with the chat panel, and the `@` mention functionality.
validation_criteria: A report on the current state of the UI, including screenshots and extracted data, is produced. This report will detail what works and what doesn't.

tasks.description: Consolidate the findings from the codebase analysis and UI investigation. Define and describe in detail the ideal final state for the file explorer feature.
validation_criteria: A clear and detailed description of the target state is created.

tasks.description: Outline the steps required to implement the desired file explorer functionality. This will not be the full implementation, but a roadmap for the required changes.
validation_criteria: A high-level plan with clear steps is created.

built_in_tools.name: run_terminal_cmd
built_in_tools.what_it_is: A tool to execute shell commands.
built_in_tools.what_it_does: Executes a given command in the user's shell.
built_in_tools.how_to_use: Provide the command string to execute.

built_in_tools.name: read_file
built_in_tools.description: Read the contents of a file.
built_in_tools.what_it_is: A tool to read files from the workspace.
built_in_tools.what_it_does: Returns the content of a specified file.
built_in_tools.how_to_use: Provide the path to the file.

built_in_tools.name: list_dir
built_in_tools.what_it_is: A tool to list files and folders in a directory.
built_in_tools.what_it_does: Returns a list of items in a given directory path.

built_in_tools.name: codebase_search
built_in_tools.what_it_is: A tool for semantic code search.
built_in_tools.what_it_does: Finds code snippets relevant to a query.
relevant_for: Finding relevant code for the file explorer

built_in_tools.name: edit_file
built_in_tools.what_it_does: Applies specified changes to a file.
built_in_tools.how_to_use: Provide the file path and the code edit.

mcp_tools.name: mcp_taskmaster_taskmaster
mcp_tools.what_it_is: A tool for managing a session of tasks.
mcp_tools.what_it_does: Creates sessions, declares capabilities, creates tasklists, and executes them.
mcp_tools.how_to_use: Follow the guided workflow (create_session, declare_capabilities, etc.).

mcp_tools.name: mcp_puppeteer
mcp_tools.what_it_is: A suite of tools to control a browser.
mcp_tools.what_it_does: Navigates, clicks, screenshots, and evaluates JS in a browser.
mcp_tools.how_to_use: Use navigate, screenshot, click, etc. actions.

mcp_tools.name: mcp_server-sequential-thinking_sequentialthinking
mcp_tools.what_it_is: A tool for breaking down complex problems.
mcp_tools.what_it_does: Guides through a sequence of thoughts to solve a problem.
